content: That was the moment for my new idea. I partnered with my ex-colleague Gregory Wisenberg, who had run growth and partnerships at Meed. He loved the idea of distributing work to the qualified, on-demand talent. Because I’d been burned in my last project, I waited before making him a co-founder. I had learned that the co-founder relationship is critical. Even if you’ve had a good relationship in the past, a new situation can trigger a change in behavior. Every idea is different, and people’s passions fluctuate.
